title: A rare picture of Malicious Metal before he mained mordekaiser

replies.body: I bet he gave an arm and leg to become who he is today LUL

**If it makes you cringe, you have to upvote it.**
I thought the first rule was, "*If it has a gif, downvote it"*.
oversimplification of the rule, "If it has a gif that has been used before, downvote it."

Wait until he meet Annie and Kog maw, and don't forget heimer so we can make them both go

Your body and a brother's arm and  leg?
Fullmetal {{champion:80}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}
http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/powerlisting/images/a/a9/I-see-what-you-did-there.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/480?cb=20130925101955

I don't

https://myanimelist.cdn-dena.com/s/common/uploaded_files/1451233265-878550b249b5c3651b18f77972829df3.jpeg

Full Metal Alchemist (awesome anime)
Brotherhood is the better one though. It sticks to the original manga.

Watched both.

Can't remember the differences besides the ending of Brotherhood had them grown up.

Watched both as well.

I just can't remember much as of right now... T_T

FMAB isn't on Toonami right now.
its on crunchyroll.com
Crunchyroll is subscription based correct?

yes and no...its like hulu or youtube kinda thing...
its free but if you want it without ads you have to subscribe.
Ah okay. Though with my work schedule its hard to do much of anything.

its my go-to anime place b/c it is a lot less sketchy than some other places lol.
And it has all but like 3-4 of the animes i want to watch.

sticking to manga and being better are different things.

Plus the original still had the manga guy helping with its creation and everything put in it was given the go ahead.

What I'm saying is that they are both great and one is NOT better than the other.
Better as in I personally liked it better.

well, both are still great, but personal pref always wins out. both worth a watch even if you've seen the other. though its important to start with the original, as a lot of core concepts from it are missing in brotherhood, due to the expectation that you had already seen the first one when the second one aired.
I'd recommend watching both as well.

Its a picture of Alphonse Elric (when he was younger) of the Elric brothers from the series Fullmetal Alchemist before he ended up looking like this:

http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/p__/images/0/01/Alphonse-Elric-akimamg-15618187-500-889.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140408164853&path-prefix=protagonist
http://m.jumpstart.com/JumpstartNew/brands/home/img/home-oh.png

The Elric Brothers, Edward and Alphonse, tried to bring their mother back from the dead through Alchemy. This is what happened: (With the audio out of sync.)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bvpJjbphJWQ?noredirect
When it cuts out at the end of it, Ed gives his arm to bind Al's soul to a suit of armor.

I'm not exaggerating when I say Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood is a god damn masterpiece. It's my favorite TV series, hands down.
FMA!!! LMAO THIS MADE MY DAY

http://i.imgur.com/KVFB5EI.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=Void Nargacuga,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=qAJIzQAm,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-04T23:46:56.294+0000)
>
> Its a picture of Alphonse Elric (when he was younger) of the Elric brothers from the series Fullmetal Alchemist before he ended up looking like this:
> 
> http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/p__/images/0/01/Alphonse-Elric-akimamg-15618187-500-889.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140408164853&path-prefix=protagonist
Thanks.
Both versions of the show are really good, I highly recommend if you having seen it before

Don't really like the style and it seems quite generic to me in a way. Monsters, cliché moral struggles and mediocre animation. Not right now since i'm focusing on RWBY and finished Death Note a while ago.

No monsters. More like an epic tale of war, politics, religion, alchemy/science, brotherhood, and *sacrifice* both physically and emotionally. It's considered one of the best anime ever made, and I would recommend watching Brotherhood over the first.

Generic as hell and doesn't attract me , especially with the whole brotherhood stuff which i can predict from a mile away.

I know you like it but saying "It's considered one of the best anime ever made" is just not accurate. Considered by whom? The fans? Ofcourse. RWBY is also considered one with some of the most interesting character plot line for me i've ever seen aligning with coreography and superior humor and Death Note is also considered a masterpiece. 

There's no such statement that can be accurate without looking at the numbers. I couldn't find the ranking for the anime (i guess manga's still good enough for the Japanese audience) so it only ranked 10 and 11 in the recent years on their top 10 manga rankings.

Sword Art Online was ranked first 5 years ago and the second best the first half of this year and also making the top ten list in the past 3 years despite being widely regarded as generic and "stupid" by most people i know.

Lol It's like at least top ten on a lot of anime list sites. It is also #2 on myanimelist. Maybe SAO got the top spot for that year but it's definitely not one of best of all time.

You may think FMA is generic as hell but to each his own opinion and tastes. Side note, I also watch RWBY, it's pretty good.

And so is SAO?

> but it's definitely not one of best of all time.

Based on what? Your opinion? The statistics say otherwise.  I can easily say the opposite and be biased like you even though i didn't really like it after Season 1.
